term.title: nitrenes

item.text: The neutral compound HN: having univalent nitrogen, and its derivatives RN. Aminylenes is a recognized but less widely used synonym. Other names that have been used include aminediyls, imidogens, azenes. They may exist in either a singlet or a triplet electronic state (four spin-paired electrons, or two spin-paired and two with parallel spins, respectively), e.g. CH3N: methylnitrene.
Until the 1960s, nitrenes had a totally different meaning: analogues of nitrones in which the double-bonded oxygen is replaced by double-bonded carbon, thus azomethine ylides.

term.sources: 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' Moss, G.P.;Smith, P.A.S.;Tavernier, D.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1995 67(8-9) 1307
term.seealso: 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' Muller, P.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1994 66(5) 1077
